page.title: 14TAME VALLEY COUNTRY PARK
page.content: The{River Tame}rises on the moors above{Saddleworth}and flows for twenty miles to meet the{River Mersey}in { Stockport.}A pathway has been made alongside the river. Much of this path passes through unspoilt countryside with lots of character and natural beauty. Now the whole length of the valley can be walked along well kept footpaths or towpaths. Recreational facilities are good;the canals and reservoirs provide boating and together with the scattered mill lodges,plenty of angling. Horse riding and cycling are popular and the network of footpaths provides good wallking. One great advantage is accessibility. The footpaths can be easily split into short sections so that they can be used for a short stroll, a picnic or for children to enjoy themselves.
